name: lavishness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very expensive or impressive: He liked to create an atmosphere of lavishness and luxury. The lavishness of the state rooms took my breath away.
the fact of being large in quantity or degree: People do not dare question the lavishness of his spending. The lavishness of farm subsidies means that the effect of fully freeing trade would be to raise prices by a large amount. See
lavish
More examplesFewer examplesThe Medici court in Florence was renowned for the lavishness of its wedding celebrations. The appearance of the book conveys lavishness, but with elegant restraint.The film has a lavishness of feeling and characterisation.
